title: Physicists magnetize a material with light
excerpt: MIT physicists created a long-lasting magnetic state in a material, using only light. The results provide a new way to control and switch antiferromagnetic materials, which are of interest for their potential to advance information processing and memory chip technology.

title: Can a Magnet Ever Have Only One Pole?
excerpt: Electron tornadoes that mimic “magnetic monopoles” emerge from specks of rust

title: The existence of a new kind of magnetism has been confirmed
excerpt: Altermagnets, theorised to exist but never before seen, have been measured for the first time and they could help us make new types of magnetic computers

title: The Magnet That Made the Modern World
excerpt: Masato Sagawa and John Croat explain how they invented the neodymium-iron-boron permanent magnet
